topics.body:
"@Virgil Stormblade":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55988d446368722e53000c2f#post_55988d446368722e53000c2f
That's my big problem with it. T2 should have been the end of the series, but no. No we have to drag it out and through the mud because money.

I feel that having a definitive ending is an under rated virtue in a franchise, one that too many people write off because it lets them cram in their ideas about what would be really cool.

Honestly both movies feel to me like some kinda bad fanfiction.

I must, in the spirit of full disclosure, admit to liking The Sarah Conner Chronicles though. That shit was like good fanfiction.
topics.author: 4f41ee04945b701c41002af7

topics.body:
"@gasmaskangel":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55988deb636872283e001a37#post_55988deb636872283e001a37
It did seem to be the antithesis of T1. It pretty much said "You can change the future". But then again, the attack on Cyberdyne probably had Dire consequence and The Terminator did leave his arm behind like back in T1.

It probably won't be because money
But the ending is, no Skynet
